intro: Barbacenia contasana, commonly known as the Contasana Barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Barbacenia contasana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and attractive foliage.
